content.body: What's the right repo to open an issue about/look at the spec for parsing nodes in XHTML documents? Ladybird at the moment sees "application/xhtml+xml" and creates an HTML document. So we follow the rules for parsing/tokenizing/creating nodes as per HTML spec. But that's not what anyone else does. Leading to this issue: https://github.com/LadybirdBrowser/ladybird/issues/840

based on my reading of the HTML spec, and looking at https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/10801 and https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8558 it seems like we're doing the correct thing to these XML-only constructs
both firefox 140 and chromium 138 create CDATASection and ProcessingInstruction nodes inside the div
